page.title: 03Standing Stones,New Deer
page.content: These stones are known locally as the{"Rocking Stones"}although they neither stand nor rock! The stones are to be found{about 200 metres to the {west of the road to Knaven and about {200 metres SE of grid reference {03850845.}They consist of a pair of large blocks of{quartzite}measuring about 3x1.5x1 metres each and lying side by side in an east-west direction at 151 metres above sea level. Local legend states that the{Muckle {Stane of Auchmaliddie"}was one stone lying on top of another and that the top stone would rock at the slightest touch. It is believed to have been {used by Druids}to test accused individuals. The stones lie on the land of Auchmaliddie Mains.
